{"id": 136, "body": {"name": "Summary of Work Activities: Hackbox Product Manager ( October 20 - November 20)", "summary": "A summary of all planned and completed work activities between the specified date range", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "supervisor": "yarotska.near", "description": "- Maintained [REDACTED] hackathon Devpost pages and related elements, updating Judges, ecosystem bounties, FAQs, technical resources, updates, Rules, and more.\\\\n- End-to-end administrative support for all things [REDACTED] including making necessary page updates, responding to participant questions and feedback, and offering marketing resources\\\\n- Conducted [R] Hackathon bounty winners selection, reminders and announcements, and prize delivery coordination\\\\n- Produced and delivered an additional 6 issues of the weekly [REDACTED] Digest, a newsletter for hackathon registrants.\\\\n- Supported events development for [REDACTED] City Node hosts in [Toronto](https://lu.ma/b8j0arc3?tk=UAR3CG), [Mexico1](https://lu.ma/vuqmoawr), [Mexico2](https://lu.ma/01wx69a2), [Nigeria](https://lu.ma/vl1klb5s), [India](https://blockseblock.com/hackathon_details/a89866ed-9683-41a9-9340-ffcf626ad484), and [Chiang Mai](https://lu.ma/lc8gc3r7).\\\\n- Coordinated the development of Hackbox City Node post-event reports, all of which can be reviewed [here](https://near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=community&handle=hacks&tab=activity)\\\\n- Attended weekly syncs for Events Working Group and [REDACTED] Workstream\\\\n- Added Q3 and Q4 project repositories to the Electric Capital database via GitHub pull request\\\\n\\\\n#### Timeline\\\\nStart: October 20 2024\\\\nEnd date: November 20 2024\\\\nTotal hours per week: 45\\\\nTotal hours: 180\\\\nHourly rate: $50/hr\\\\nTotal: $9000", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "nneoma.near", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "9000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": ["Hackbox"]}

{"body": {"name": "BlueSense,[REDACTED] Hackathon Mexico Node,Menci\\\\u{f3}n honorifica", "summary": "Winning project at the REDACTED Hackathon City node\\\\nMexico.", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "supervisor": null, "description": "\\\\nBlueSense is a conceptual proposal aimed at transforming water quality monitoring through the use of advanced technology. The proposal seeks to develop a platform designed to receive key data from sensors that would measure essential parameters such as pH, turbidity, dissolved oxygen and water temperature. These indicators are crucial to evaluate water quality and detect possible contaminants.\\\\n\\\\nBlueSense\\\\\\'s proposal includes the use of artificial intelligence (AI) to analyze this data in real time. Through machine learning algorithms, AI could identify patterns and trends that help anticipate water quality issues before they become significant public health risks. In addition, BlueSense proposes the registration of all data in a blockchain, thus ensuring the integrity and transparency of the information. This approach would ensure that the data cannot be tampered with, giving users confidence in the accuracy of water quality information.\\\\n\\\\nAs part of the proposal, a dynamic map would be integrated into the platform to visually show the status of the different water sources that are being monitored. This map would provide users with an intuitive and interactive way to access water quality information at various locations, improving accessibility and understanding.\\\\n\\\\nBy leveraging these technologies, BlueSense aims to empower communities by providing them with tools to make informed decisions based on accurate and up-to-date water quality data.\\\\nLink Taikai: https://taikai.network/es/hackbox/hackathons/REDACTED-mexico-node/projects/cm2mdau6e00wlbssl9sk3innk/idea\\\\nDemo: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0bCwhKrLRl8\\\\nGithub:https://github.com/Dashxl/BlueSenSe\\\\n", "linked_proposals": [45], "receiver_account": "felipeandrade.near", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "250", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDT"}, "labels": ["Bounty"], "accepted_terms_and_conditions_version": 133536790}

{"data": {"events-committee.near": {"post": {"main": "{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"text\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"We have just received a new *Bounty* proposal.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**By**: @felipeandrade.near\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Title**: \\\\u{201c}BlueSense,[REDACTED] Hackathon Mexico Node,Menci\\\\u{f3}n honorifica\\\\u{201c}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Summary**:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nWinning project at the REDACTED Hackathon City node\\\\\\\\nMexico.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nRead the full proposal and share your feedback on [DevHub](/events-committee.near/widget/app?page=proposal&id=152)\\\\\\\"}"}, "index": {"post": "{\\\\\\\"key\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"main\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"value\\\\\\\":{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\"}}"}}}}

The proposal seeks to develop a platform designed to receive key data from sensors that would measure essential parameters such as pH, turbidity, dissolved oxygen and water temperature. In addition, BlueSense proposes the registration of all data in a blockchain, thus ensuring the integrity and transparency of the information.
